# Dear Ms.: A Revolution in Print

Dear Ms.: A Revolution in Print is a 2025 documentary film, directed by Alice Gu, Cecilia Aldarondo, and Salima Koroma. It explores the history of Ms. magazine.
It had its world premiere at Tribeca Festival on June 10, 2025, and is scheduled to be released on July 2, 2025, by HBO.
Premise
Explores the history of Ms. magazine. Gloria Steinem, Letty Cottin Pogrebin, Pat Carbine, Suzanne Braun Levine, Jane O'Reilly, Marcia Ann Gillespie, Michelle Wallace, Lisa Coleman, Lindsy Van Gelder, Alan Alda, Robin Morgan, Ellen Sweet, Annie Sprinkle, Veronica Vera, Robin Leonardi, and Carole S. Vance are interviewed in the film.
Release
The film had its world premiere at Tribeca Festival on June 10, 2025. It is scheduled to be released on July 2, 2025.
Reception
Critical reception
Elizabeth Weitzman of TheWrap wrote: "A fascinating, complex story that needs to be told." Christopher Llewyn Reed of Film Festival Today gave the film 4 out of 5 stars wrote: "A very well-balanced documentary determined to tell the story in all its highs and lows. That objective approach is itself noteworthy."
